text:
An advantage of only using actual price and volume data is that they are observable.
Much of the data used in fundamental analysis is subject to assumptions or restatements,
and might not be available at all for assets such as currencies or commodities. (This
does not, however, imply that technical analysis itself is objective; both kinds of analysis
require subjective judgment.) Another advantage of technical analysis is that it can
be applied to the prices of assets that do not produce future cash flows (dividends or
